```{r setup}
library(ggplot2)
library(fivethirtyeight)
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
``
#set the data to be used
data = congress_age

#Make subsets of the data by party
republicans <- subset(data, party == "R")
democrats <- subset(congress_age, party == "D")

#Wrangle the data so y can be the mean for each year
mutate(republicans, rep_age = mean(republicans$age))
names(rep_age)

#Make the ggplot, separate line for each party
congress_plot = ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data = rep_age, aes(x = termstart, y = mean), color = "red") +
  geom_line(data = democrats, aes(x = termstart, y = age), color = "blue") +
  xlab('') +
  ylab('') + ggtitle("Average Age of New Members of Congress") + geom_text(aes(x = as.Date("1970-06-07"), y = 52.8), label = "Republicans", color = "red")
print(congress_plot)
